column4: hi i can't seem to use the log function in C code anymore.. on both desktop and laptop, get this error: findAI.c:(.text+0x1265): undefined reference to `log'
even though the code compiled and ran perfectly before
i think it was due to an ubuntu update cos a few days ago it was fine
but i need the code to compile
ok but i don't know which package caused the problem
maybe i'll try booting an older kernel
have you got the GNU math library (/usr/lib/libm.a) on your link libraries list
how do i check if i do?
i just compile the c code directly, don't use a makefile
so whats giving you the error then? It sounds like a linker error
BlueEagle sorry i mean this http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/2600/
that looks to me as if the LOG2 function relies on 'lg' which is in another library
but that error suggests an unresolved external reference
ah nevermind i figured it out
